Description: THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING UNDER THE ADDITIONAL SUPPLEMENTAL APPROPRIATIONS FOR DISASTER RELIEF ACT, 2019, (PUBLIC LAW 116-20) TO THE COMMONWEALTH OF NORTHERN MARIANA ISLANDS, DIVISION OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY TO BUILD CAPACITY IN MANAGING POST-STORM SOLID WASTE ISSUES DUE TO TYPHOON YUTU. THE GOAL OF THIS PROJECT IS TO INCREASE SOLID WASTE REGULATORY CAPACITY TO ADDRESS POST-STORM SOLID WASTE ISSUES, DEVELOP AND REGULATE LONG-TERM SUSTAINABLE SOLID AND ZERO WASTE PROGRAMS THAT ADDRESSES HISTORIC SHORTCOMINGS, AND INCREASE PREPAREDNESS OF THEIR SOLID WASTE MANAGEMENT PROGRAMS FROM FUTURE STORMS. THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT PROVIDE FULL FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $526,119.  PREAWARD COSTS ARE APPROVED BACK TO MARCH 1, 2021.  NOTE THAT THE HEADER OF THIS AWARD CAPTION INDICATES GRANT AGREEMENT WHEREAS THIS IS A COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT (REFER TO PROGRAMMATIC TERMS AND CONDITIONS).

THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING UNDER THE ADDITIONAL SUPPLEMENTAL APPROPRIATIONS FOR DISASTER RELIEF ACT, 2019, (PUBLIC LAW 116-20) TO THE COMMONWEALTH OF NORTHERN MARIANA ISLANDS, OFFICE OF PLANNING AND DEVELOPMENT TO PLAN FOR, AND BUILD CAPACITY IN MANAGING POST-STORM SOLID WASTE ISSUES DUE TO TYPHOON YUTU. THE GOAL OF THIS PROJECT IS TO BUILD SOLID WASTE MANAGEMENT CAPACITY TO ADDRESS POST-STORM SOLID WASTE ISSUES AND DEVELOP LONG-TERM SUSTAINABLE SOLID AND ZERO WASTE PROGRAMS THAT ADDRESSES HISTORIC SHORTCOMINGS AND INCREASE PREPAREDNESS FOR MANAGING WASTE FROM FUTURE STORMS.  THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT PROVIDES FULL FEDERAL FUNDS $565,980.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO DELAWARE DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES AND ENVIRONMENTAL CONTROL (DNREC) FOR THE DEVELOPMENT AND IMPLEMENTATION OF AN AUTHORIZED HAZARDOUS WASTE MANAGEMENT PROGRAM IN THE STATE OF DELAWARE TO CONTROL THE GENERATION, TRANSPORTATION, TREATMENT, STORAGE, AND DISPOSAL OF HAZARDOUS WASTE; TO MINIMIZE HAZARDOUS WASTE PRODUCTION; AND TO PROTECT HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT FROM INACTIVE HAZARDOUS WASTE FACILITIES. THIS ACTION PARTIALLY FUNDS THE GRANT IN THE AMOUNT OF $771,658. FEDERAL FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $1,525,306 ARE CONTINGENT UPON AVAILABILITY OF ADDITIONAL FUNDING.ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFOMED INCLUDE PERMITTING, CORRECTIVE ACTION, INSPECTIONS, ENFORCEMENT, COMPUTERIZED TRACKING, ENSURING DATA QUALITY, AND POLLUTION PREVENTION OUTREACH. THIS WILL HELP TO PRESERVE AND RESTORE THE LAND BY REDUCING WASTE GENERATION AND BY MANAGING HAZARDOUS WASTES PROPERLY.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:DNREC WILL IMPLEMENT A STATE PROGRAM TO OVERSEE THE OPERATIONS AND REMEDIATION OF HAZARDOUS WASTE FACILITIES, INCLUDING PERMITTING, RCRA CORRECTIVE ACTION, ENFORCEMENT, QUALITY ASSURANCE REVIEW, AND THE MINIMIZATION OF HAZARDOUS WASTE PRODUCTION IN THE STATE OF DELAWARE. THE DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROGRAM INCLUDE STATE RESIDENTS.

THIS AGREEMENT IS FOR THE DEVELOPMENT AND IMPLEMENTATION OF AN AUTHORIZED HAZARDOUS WASTE MANAGEMENT PROGRAM IN THE STATE OF DELAWARE TO CONTROL THE GENERATION, TRANSPORTATION, TREATMENT, STORAGE, AND DISPOSAL OF HAZARDOUS WASTE; TO MINIMIZE HAZARDOUS WASTE PRODUCTION; AND TO PROTECT HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT FROM INACTIVE HAZARDOUS WASTE FACILITIES.  ACTIVITIES INCLUDE PERMITTING, CORRECTIVE ACTION, INSPECTIONS, ENFORCEMENT, COMPUTERIZED TRACKING, ENSURING DATA QUALITY, AND POLLUTION PREVENTION OUTREACH.  THIS WILL HELP TO PRESERVE AND RESTORE THE LAND BY REDUCING WASTE GENERATION AND BY MANAGING HAZARDOUS WASTES PROPERLY.  FEDERAL FUNDS OF $2,166,000 FUNDS ARE CONTINGENT UPON AVAILABILITY.
TO SUPPORT THE DEVELOPMENT/IMPLEMENTATION OF THE DELAWARE'S PROGRAM CONTROLLING THE GENERATION, TRANSPORT, TREATMENT, STORAGE AND DISPOSAL OF HAZARDO

THE PROJECT'S GOAL IS TO ADDRESS POST-STORM SOLID WASTE ISSUES AND DEVELOP A LONG-TERM SUSTAINABLE SOLID WASTE PROGRAM THAT ADDRESSES HISTORIC SHORTCOMINGS AND INCREASE PREPAREDNESS FOR MANAGING WASTE FROM FUTURE STORMS.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT IS FOR DEVELOPMENT AND IMPLEMENTATION OF AN AUTHORIZED HAZARDOUS WASTE MANAGEMENT PROGRAM IN THE STATE OF OHIO TO CONTROL THE GENERATION, TRANSPORTATION, TREATMENT, STORAGE, AND DISPOSAL OF HAZARDOUS WASTE; TO MINIMIZE HAZARDOUS WASTE PRODUCTION; AND TO PROTECT HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT FROM INACTIVE HAZARDOUS WASTE FACILITIES. ACTIVITIES INCLUDE PERMITTING, CORRECTIVE ACTION, INSPECTIONS, ENFORCEMENT, COMPUTERIZED TRACKING, ENSURING DATA QUALITY, AND POLLUTION PREVENTION OUTREACH. THIS WILL HELP TO PRESERVE AND RESTORE THE LAND FOR THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF OHIO BY REDUCING WASTE GENERATION AND BY MANAGING HAZARDOUS WASTES PROPERLY.ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES REQUIRED BY THIS GRANT IS ACCOMPLISHED BY OHIO EPA'S HAZARDOUS WASTE PROGRAM. OHIO EPA'S HAZARDOUS WASTE PROGRAM REGULATES 44 PERMITTED TREATMENT, STORAGE, OR DISPOSAL FACILITIES: THE MANAGEMENT AND TREATMENT OF HAZARDOUS WASTE FROM APPROXIMATELY 678 NONSHY; RETAIL/PHARMACY LARGE QUANTITY GENERATORS, 2,736 SMALL QUANTITY GENERATORS, APPROXIMATELY 12,336 VERY SMALL QUANTITY GENERATORS, AND 427 USED OIL HANDLERS. ADDITIONALLY, OHIO'S HAZARDOUS WASTE PROGRAM ASSESSES AND REQUIRES CLEANUP OF 300 PRE-REGULATION CONTAMINATED SITES, AS WELL AS 150 RESOURCE CONSERVATION AND RECOVERY ACT (RCRA) DRIVEN SITES THAT MANAGED HAZARDOUS WASTE. OHIO'S HAZARDOUS WASTE PROGRAM HAS RESPONSIBILITY FOR INSPECTING RCRA FACILITIES THAT ARE NO LONGER IN THE OPERATING UNIVERSE TO ENSURE THEY ARE MEETING COMPLIANCE REQUIREMENTS.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES ARE ACCOMPLISHED BY OHIO EPA'S HAZARDOUS WASTE PROGRAM TO ACHIEVE RCRA CORRECTIVE ACTION GOALS; COMPLETE HAZARDOUS WASTE FACILITY PERMITTING AND CLOSURE ACTIONS; CONDUCT INSPECTIONS, ENFORCE ENVIRONMENTAL LAWS; AND AND MANAGE RCRA INFO AND RULE/PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT.
SCHEDULED DELIVERABLES ARE: 
JANUARY 2023 - FFY22 YEAR-END CONFERENCE CALL WITH US EPA. THIS MEETING WILL REVIEW THE YEAR END SUMMARY REPORT FINDINGS AND PROVIDE FEEDBACK ON PROGRAMMATIC ISSUES.
MARCH 30, 2023 - MID-YEAR REPORT TO US EPA ON RCRA ACCOMPLISHMENTS AND PROGRESS ON FEDERAL FISCAL YEAR GOALS.
SEPTEMBER 15, 2023 - RCRA CORRECTIVE ACTION ACCOMPLISHMENTS INTO RCRAINFO.
SEPTEMBER 30, 2023 - END OF FEDERAL FISCAL YEAR 2023. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE THE STATE OF OHIO.

IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE STATUTORY AUTHORITY DELEGATED TO EPA UNDER THE RESOURCE CONSERVATION AND RECOVERY ACT (RCRA), THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT WILL ADDRESS U.S. EPA REGION 5&RSQUOANDS PRIORITY OF WASTED FOOD SOLUTIONS FOR OHIO PHASE II TO DEVELOP AND BUILD ON RESOURCES THAT SUPPORT WASTED FOOD DIVERSION. DURING PHASE 1, CET AND PARTNERS IDENTIFIED A NEED FOR A RESOURCE TO INCENTIVIZE PREVENTION. ADDITIONALLY, FOLLOWING THIS WORK, CET RECEIVED SEVERAL REQUESTS FROM COMMUNITIES OUTSIDE THE SOUTHWEST OHIO REGION, THE TARGET GEOGRAPHY FOR PHASE1, FOR RESOURCES FOCUSED ON WASTED FOOD REDUCTION, RECOVERY, AND DIVERSION. PHASE II WILL ADDRESS THESE GAPS. CET WILL CAPITALIZE ON OUR NATIONAL EXPERIENCE WITH BUSINESSES WHOSE CORE OPERATIONS DO NOT FOCUS ON WASTED FOOD DIVERSION, TO CURATE RESOURCES THAT ELEVATE THE PROFILE OF, AND AWARENESS FOR, WASTE REDUCTION AND RECOVERY IN OHIO. THESE RESOURCES WILL ADDRESS COMMON CHALLENGES (I.E. COMMUNICATION WITH BUSINESSES AND/OR SOURCE REDUCTION), AND BE MODIFIED TO HELP OUR PARTNERS (I.E. CLEVELAND DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HAMILTON COUNTY SOLID WASTE MANAGEMENT DISTRICT) COMMUNICATE WITH BUSINESSES MORE EFFECTIVELY AND EFFICIENTLY. CET&RSQUOANDS OUTREACH PLAN INCLUDES SHARING THESE RESOURCES WITH OUR PARTNERS AND KEY STAKEHOLDERS IN OHIO (SUCH AS, SOLID WASTE AUTHORITY OF CENTRAL OHIO AND EPA REGION 5) TO DISSEMINATE, AND POSTING MATERIALS ON OUR ORGANIZATION&RSQUOANDS WASTED FOOD SOLUTIONS WEBSITE.

IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE STATUTORY AUTHORITY DELEGATED TO EPA UNDER THE RESOURCE CONSERVATION AND RECOVERY ACT (RCRA), THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT WILL ADDRESS U.S. EPA REGION 5'S PRIORITY OF THE REGIONAL COLLABORATION TO MAKE THE CASE FOR RECYCLING MARKET DEVELOPMENT AS A CREATIVE APPROACH TO ADDRESS SUSTAINABLE MATERIAL MANAGEMENT PRIORITIES BY EXPANDING THE NETWORK OF RECYCLERS, COMMUNITY, TRADE PROFESSIONAL ORGANIZATION, AND GOVERNMENTS IN REGION 5 TO ADVANCE RECYCLING SYSTEMS AND MARKETS, UPGRADE AND EXPAND THE EPA REGION 4 INTEGRATED SOLID WASTE MANAGEMENT TOOL (ISWM) WITH THE HELP OF THE CONSULTANT RESOURCE RECYCLING SYSTEMS (LOCATED IN MI).  THE MICHIGAN RECYCLING COALITION (MRC) WILL THEN PLAN TO TRAIN ADDITIONAL STAKEHOLDERS IN REGION 5 AND MICHIGAN ON THE TOOL TO 'MAKE THE CASE' FOR RECYCLING.  THE MAJOR ACTIVITIES AND PLANNED OUTPUTS/OUTCOMES ARE AS FOLLOWED; UPDATES TO THE ISWM TOOL WITH RRS,  STAKEHOLDERS IN THE STUDY REGION WILL BE IDENTIFIED, ENGAGED IN USING THE ISWM VIA

DESCRIPTION:THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS TO SUPPORT STATE SOLID AND HAZARDOUS WASTE PROGRAM ACTIVITIES. THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT TO THE NORTHEAST WASTE MANAGEMENT OFFICIALS' ASSOCIATION WILL ALLOW THE EXCHANGE OF TECHNICAL INFORMATION AND PROMOTE COOPERATION AND COORDINATION OF TECHNICAL AND POLICY ISSUES AMONG THE MEMBER STATES IN REGION 1 AND NEW YORK AND NEW JERSEY.ACTIVITIES:ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED WITH THIS FUNDING INCLUDE: 
-	CONDUCTING PROJECTS AND ACTIVITIES FOCUSED ON ADDRESSING SOLID AND HAZARDOUS WASTE ISSUES IN THE NORTHEAST
-	PROVIDING A FORUM FOR COORDINATION, INFORMATION EXCHANGE, AND COOPERATION ON WASTE ISSUES AMONG STATES AND WITH EPA
-	ORGANIZING NEWMOA BOARD MEETINGS, VIRTUAL MEETINGS, AND WEBINARS 
-	CONDUCTING TRAINING FOR INSPECTORS AND PROGRAM STAFF ON RCRA SUBTITLE C HAZARDOUS WASTE TOPICS
-	CONDUCTING RCRA-RELATED REGULATORY AND POLICY REVIEWS 
-	FACILITATING NEWMOA WORKING GROUPS
-	ORGANIZING WORKGROUP VIRTUAL MEETINGS / WEBINARS 
-	CONDUCTING RESEARCH ON POLICY AND TECHNICAL MATTERS CONCERNING HAZARDOUS WASTE AND SOLID WASTE AND SMM 
SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:DELIVERABLES
-	BOARD MEETING BRIEFING MATERIALS AND MEETING NOTES
-	NOTES AND OTHER MATERIALS FROM VIRTUAL COMMITTEE AND WORKGROUP MEETINGS
-	DRAFT COMMENT LETTERS TO EPA FOR NEWMOA'S BOARD OF DIRECTORS ON PROPOSED POLICIES AND RULES, AS APPROPRIATE
-	POLICY AND PROGRAM DOCUMENTS DISSEMINATED AND PUBLISHED ONLINE
-	ANNUAL REPORT
-	WRITE-UP OF THE RESULTS OF ANY ANNUAL SURVEYS ON STATE HW AND SW TRAINING PRIORITIES, IF NEEDED
-	FINAL ANNUAL TRAINING PLAN FOR HAZARDOUS WASTE AND SOLID WASTE
-	NOTES, PRESENTATIONS/RECORDINGS, AND OTHER MEETING MATERIALS FROM TRAINING WEBINARS AND WORKSHOPS
-	WRITE-UPS SUMMARIZING BEST PRACTICES OR SUGGESTED IMPROVEMENTS REGARDING THE LANGUAGE IN STATE PERMITS AND PROCEDURES SURROUNDING PERMIT ISSUANCE

THIS PROJECT WILL MONITOR COMPLIANCE WITH HAZARDOUS WASTE MANAGEMENT REGULATIONS IN ARIZONA AT HAZARDOUS WASTE GENERATORS AND FACILITIES, ISSUE PERMITS, MANAGE CLEANUP OF CONTAMINATED SITES, INSPECT TRUCKS IMPORTING HAZARDOUS WASTE AT THE MEXICO BORDER, DEVELOP PROJECTS TO REDUCE WASTE AND INCREASE RECYCLING, AND AUTHORIZE STATE LEGISLATION FOR HAZARDOUS WASTE MANAGEMENT.  THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT PROVIDES PARTIAL FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $652,561.  PREAWARD COSTS HAVE BEEN APPROVED BACK TO 7/01/2017.  SEE TERMS AND CONDITIONS.

THIS AGREEMENT IS FOR DEVELOPMENT AND IMPLEMENTATION OF AN AUTHORIZED HAZARDOUS WASTE MANAGEMENT PROGRAM IN THE STATE OF HAWAII TO CONTROL THE GENERATION, TRANSPORTATION, TREATMENT, STORAGE, AND DISPOSAL OF HAZARDOUS WASTE; TO MINIMIZE HAZARDOUS WASTE PRODUCTION; AND TO PROTECT HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT FROM INACTIVE HAZARDOUS WASTE FACILITIES. ACTIVITIES INCLUDE PERMITTING, CORRECTIVE ACTION, INSPECTIONS, ENFORCEMENT, COMPUTERIZED TRACKING, ENSURING DATA QUALITY AND POLLUTION PREVENTION OUTREACH. THIS WILL HELP TO PRESERVE AND RESTORE THE LAND BY REDUCING WASTE GENERATION AND BY MANAGING HAZARDOUS WASTES PROPERLY. 

THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT PROVIDES PARTIAL FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $530,000.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS AGREEMENT IS TO PROVIDE FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO THE KANSAS DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND ENVIRONMENT HAZARDOUS WASTE MANAGEMENT PROGRAM. ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED ARE: HAZARDOUS WASTE IDENTIFICATION, REGULATIONS GOVERNING HAZARDOUS WASTE GENERATORS, TRANSPORTERS, AND TREATMENT, STORAGE, AND DISPOSAL FACILITIES (TSDFS), RECYCLING AND UNIVERSAL WASTES, LAND DISPOSAL RESTRICTIONS, PERMITTING OF TREATMENT, STORAGE, AND DISPOSAL FACILITIES, INCLUDING COMBUSTION FACILITIES, PARTICIPATE IN CORRECTIVE ACTION ACTIVITIES TO CLEAN UP HAZARDOUS WASTE CONTAMINATION, ENFORCEMENT OF HAZARDOUS WASTE REGULATIONS, COMPLIANCE ASSISTANCE, AND ASSUMING PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITY FOR IMPLEMENTING THE HAZARDOUS WASTE MANAGEMENT PROGRAM, INCLUDING ONGOING REGULATION DEVELOPMENT.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES: THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES ARE TO REDUCE WASTE GENERATION, AND MINIMIZE HAZARDOUS WASTE PRODUCTION. THE DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROGRAM INCLUDE THE STATE OF KANSAS RESIDENTS.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS AGREEMENT IS TO PROVIDE FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO THE KANSAS DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND ENVIRONMENT HAZARDOUS WASTE MANAGEMENT PROGRAM. THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED ARE: HAZARDOUS WASTE IDENTIFICATION, REGULATIONS GOVERNING HAZARDOUS WASTE GENERATORS, TRANSPORTERS, AND TREATMENT, STORAGE, AND DISPOSAL FACILITIES (TSDFS), RECYCLING AND UNIVERSAL WASTES, LAND DISPOSAL RESTRICTIONS, PERMITTING OF TREATMENT, STORAGE, AND DISPOSAL FACILITIES, INCLUDING COMBUSTION FACILITIES, PARTICIPATE IN CORRECTIVE ACTION ACTIVITIES TO CLEAN UP HAZARDOUS WASTE CONTAMINATION, ENFORCEMENT OF HAZARDOUS WASTE REGULATIONS, COMPLIANCE ASSISTANCE, AND ASSUMING PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITY FOR IMPLEMENTING THE HAZARDOUS WASTE MANAGEMENT PROGRAM, INCLUDING ONGOING REGULATION DEVELOPMENT. THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES ARE TO REDUCE WASTE GENERATION, AND MINIMIZE HAZARDOUS WASTE PRODUCTION. THE DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROGRAM INCLUDE THE STATE OF KANSAS RESIDENTS.

IN THIS AGREEMENT MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENT, GREAT LAKES, AND ENERGY (EGLE), MATERIALS MANAGEMENT DIVISION (MMD), IS COMMITTING TO ACCOMPLISH, DURING FISCAL YEARS (FY) 2022 - 2023, BASED ON THE UNITED STATES ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY&RSQUOANDS (U.S. EPA) FEDERAL FUNDING LEVELS, ITS ROLE OF ADMINISTERING THE NATIONAL SOLID WASTE DISPOSAL ACT OF 1965, IN MICHIGAN, AS AMENDED BY THE RESOURCE CONSERVATION AND RECOVERY ACT OF 1976, AS AMENDED (RCRA), AS AMENDED BY THE HAZARDOUS AND SOLID WASTE AMENDMENTS OF 1984.  ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: RCRA REVISION CHECKLISTS 240 TO 243 AND SUBSEQUENT CHECKLISTS, AS THE PROCESS ALLOWS, TO CONTINUE TO WORK WITH THE U.S. EPA AS IT ROLLS OUT TOOLS TO INCORPORATE ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE AND CLIMATE CHANGE INITIATIVES INTO THE RCRA PROGRAM, TO REDUCE THE GENERATION OF HAZARDOUS WASTE BY INCREASING COMPLIANCE BY PROVIDING COMPLIANCE ASSISTANCE TO THE REGULATED COMMUNITY THROUGH REGULAR INSPECTIONS AND NUMEROUS OUTREACH EFFORTS, TO ENCOURAGE THE REGULATED COMMUNITY TO VOLUNTARILY DISCOVER, DISCLOSE, AND CORRECT VIOLATIONS BEFORE THEY ARE IDENTIFIED BY REGULATORY AGENCIES TO ENSURE CORRECTION OF VIOLATIONS IN A TIMELY MANNER TO PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT, FOSTER HW PROGRAM INTEGRITY, AND DETER FUTURE NONCOMPLIANCE, TO INSPECT ACTIVE TSDFS ONE TIME PER YEAR IN WHICH INSPECTIONS WILL INCLUDE AT LEAST ONE DISTRICT COMPLIANCE AND ENFORCEMENT INSPECTION (CEI), GROUNDWATER MONITORING EVALUATION (GME)/ OPERATION AND MAINTENANCE (O&AMPANDM), POST-CLOSURE CAP (PC CAP), CA COVER/CAP, CA MAINTENANCE AND MONITORING (CAMM), OR CA COMPLIANCE INSPECTION.

THIS AGREEMENT IS FOR DEVELOPMENT AND IMPLEMENTATION OF AN AUTHORIZED HAZARDOUS WASTE MANAGEMENT PROGRAM IN THE STATE OF MICHIGAN TO CONTROL THE GENERATION, TRANSPORTATION, TREATMENT, STORAGE, AND DISPOSAL OF HAZARDOUS WASTE; TO MINIMIZE HAZARDOUS WASTE PRODUCTION; AND TO PROTECT HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT FROM INACTIVE HAZARDOUS WASTE FACILITIES.  ACTIVITIES INCLUDE PERMITTING, CORRECTIVE ACTION, INSPECTIONS, ENFORCEMENT, COMPUTERIZED TRACKING, ENSURING DATA QUALITY, AND POLLUTION PREVENTION OUTREACH.  THIS WILL HELP TO PRESERVE AND RESTORE THE LAND BY REDUCING WASTE GENERATION AND BY MANAGING HAZARDOUS WASTES PROPERLY.

THIS PROJECT IS TO SUPPORT THE RESOURCE CONSERVATION AND RECOVERY ACT (RCRA) OF 1976, SUBTITLE C HAZARDOUS WASTE MANAGEMENT PROGRAM IN THE STATE OF MICHIGAN FOR FEDERAL FISCAL YEARS 2018 AND 2019.  THE STATE'S SPECIFIC INITIATIVES AND PRIORITIES RELATE TO THE FOLLOWING: STATE AUTHORIZATION; ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE; COMPLIANCE AND ENFORCEMENT; ADMINISTRATIVE CONTROLS; CORRECTIVE ACTION; FINANCIAL CAPABILITY;  MANAGEMENT AND REPORTING; AND WASTE MINIMIZATION.

THIS ACTION APPROVES PARTIAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $392,676 TO TENNESSEE DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENT AND CONSERVATION IN SUPPORT OF THEIR CONTINUING ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAM GRANT, WHICH WILL HELP TO PRESERVE AND RESTORE LAND BY REDUCING WASTE GENERATION AND MANAGING HAZARDOUS WASTES PROPERLY. NOTE THAT THE HEADER OF THIS AWARD CAPTIONS IT AS A GRANT AGREEMENT WHEREAS IT IS A COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT. DESCRIPTION:THIS ACTION PROVIDES PARTIAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $255,690.00 TO SUPPORT THE NORTH CAROLINA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY ONGOING PROGRAM TO DEVELOP AND IMPLEMENT THE RESOURCE CONSERVATION AND RECOVERY ACT. THE ACTIVITIES INCLUDE  THE PERMITTING, CORRECTIVE ACTION, CLOSURE, COMPLIANCE, AND ENFORCEMENT PROGRAMS IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE MEMORANDUM OF AGREEMENT BETWEEN THE STATE AND THE ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY FOR ITS AUTHORIZED HAZARDOUS WASTE PROGRAM. THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERIES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES ARE TO CONTROL THE GENERATION, TRANSPORTATION, TREATMENT, STORAGE, AND DISPOSAL OF HAZARDOUS WASTE; TO MINIMIZE HAZARDOUS WASTE PRODUCTION; AND TO PROTECT HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT FROM INACTIVE HAZARDOUS WASTE FACILITIES. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE THE RESIDENTS OF THE STATE OF NORTH CAROLINA.
